org.jlab.coda.et

Class EtEventImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.et.EtEventImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EtEvent

    public class EtEventImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements EtEvent
    This class defines an ET event.
    Author:
    Carl Timmer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EtEventImpl(EtEventImpl ev)
      Creates an event object by duplicating another.
      EtEventImpl(int size)
      Creates an event object for users of Java-based ET systems or by the system itself.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Age getAge()
      Gets the age of the event, either Age.NEW if a new event obtained through calling EtSystem.newEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, int, int, int) or Age.USED if obtained through calling EtSystem.getEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Modify, int, int).

      Gets the event data's byte order.

      Gets a reference to the event's control array without copying.

      Gets the data array which is backing the event's data buffer if there is one.

      Gets the event's data buffer.

      Set the event data's byte order.
      void setByteOrder(int endian)
      Set the event data's byte order by using values consistent with C-based ET systems, EtConstants.endianBig, EtConstants.endianLittle, EtConstants.endianLocal, EtConstants.endianNotLocal, or EtConstants.endianSwitch.

      Sets the event's control array by copying it into the event.

      Sets the owner of the event (attachment using event or system).

      Sets the event's priority, either high Priority.HIGH or low Priority.LOW.
      void setRawByteOrder(int byteOrder)
      Set the event data's byte order as big with 0x04030201 or as little with 0x01020304.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EtEventImpl

        public EtEventImpl(int size)
        Creates an event object for users of Java-based ET systems or by the system itself. Event objects are only created once in the ET system process - when the ET system is started up.
        Parameters:
        size - size of the data array in bytes

      • EtEventImpl

        public EtEventImpl(EtEventImpl ev)
        Creates an event object by duplicating another.
        Parameters:
        ev - event to duplicate

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize an event's fields. Called for an event each time it passes through GRAND_CENTRAL station.
        Specified by:
        init in interface EtEvent

      • getAge

        public org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Age getAge()
        Gets the age of the event, either Age.NEW if a new event obtained through calling EtSystem.newEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, int, int, int) or Age.USED if obtained through calling EtSystem.getEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Modify, int, int).
        Specified by:
        getAge in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        age of the event.

      • getGroup

        public int getGroup()
        Gets the group the event belongs to (1, 2, ...) if ET system events are divided into groups. If not, group = 1. Used so some producers don't hog events from others.
        Specified by:
        getGroup in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        the group the event belongs to.

      • getPriority

        public org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Priority getPriority()
        Gets the event's priority, either high Priority.HIGH or low Priority.LOW. Low priority is normal while high priority events get placed at the front of stations' input and output event lists.
        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        event's priority.

      • getPriorityValue

        public int getPriorityValue()
        Get int value associated with Priority enum.
        Returns:
        int value associated with Priority enum

      • getOwner

        public int getOwner()
        Gets the attachment id of the attachment which owns or got the event. If it's owned by the system its value is EtConstants.system.
        Specified by:
        getOwner in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        id of owning attachment or EtConstants.system if system owns it

        public int getSizeLimit()

      • getDataStatus

        public org.jlab.coda.et.enums.DataStatus getDataStatus()
        Gets the status of the data (set by the system), which can be OK DataStatus.OK, corrupted DataStatus.CORRUPT, or possibly corrupted DataStatus.POSSIBLYCORRUPT. Data is OK by default, it is never labeled as corrupt but can be labeled as possible corrupt if the process owning an event crashes and the system recovers it.
        Specified by:
        getDataStatus in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        status of the data.

      • getDataStatusValue

        public int getDataStatusValue()
        Get int value associated with DataStatus enum.
        Returns:
        int value associated with DataStatus enum

      • getModify

        public org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Modify getModify()
        Gets the event's modify value when receiving it over the network. This specifies whether the user wants to read the event only, will modify only the event header (everything except the data), or will modify the data and/or header. Modifying the data and/or header is Modify.ANYTHING, modifying only the header is Modify.HEADER, else the default assumed, Modify.NOTHING, is that nothing is modified resulting in this event being put back into the ET system (by remote server) immediately upon being copied and that copy sent to the user.
        Specified by:
        getModify in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        event's modify value.

      • getByteOrder

        public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Gets the event data's byte order.
        Specified by:
        getByteOrder in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        event data's byte order

      • getRawByteOrder

        public int getRawByteOrder()
        Gets the raw byte order data (0x04030201 or 0x01020304).
        Specified by:
        getRawByteOrder in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        raw byte order data (0x04030201 or 0x01020304).

      • getControl

        public int[] getControl()
        Gets a copy of the event's control array. This is an array of integers which can be used for any purpose by the user.
        Specified by:
        getControl in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        copy of event's control array.

      • getControlNoCopy

        public int[] getControlNoCopy()
        Gets a reference to the event's control array without copying. This is an additional method added later to facilitate minimizing garbage creation. This is an array of integers which can be used for any purpose by the user.
        Specified by:
        getControlNoCopy in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        event's control array.

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
               throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets the data array which is backing the event's data buffer if there is one. Any changes to the array will be reflected in the buffer. If there is no backing data array, as is the case when a user connects to a local, C-based ET system (memory mapped buffer) then an exception is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getData in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        data array which is backing the event's data buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there is no backing array

      • getDataBuffer

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getDataBuffer()
        Gets the event's data buffer.
        Specified by:
        getDataBuffer in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        event's data buffer.

      • isTemp

        public boolean isTemp()
        Gets whether this event is a temporary event or not. For java-based ET systems this is always false. If this event represents an event in a local, C-based ET system (through JNI), this can be true if its memory is larger than that of the normal events necessitating the temporary allocation of another chunk of shared memory just for this event.
        Specified by:
        isTemp in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        true if this events represents a local, C-based ET system temp event, else false.

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Sets the event's id number.
        Parameters:
        id - event's id number

      • setAge

        public void setAge(org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Age age)
        Sets the age of the event which is Age.NEW for new events obtained by calling EtSystem.newEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, int, int, int)), or Age.NEW for "used" event obtained by calling EtSystem.getEvents(EtAttachment, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Mode, org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Modify, int, int)).
        Parameters:
        age - age of the event

      • setGroup

        public void setGroup(int group)
        Sets the group the event belongs to: (1, 2, ...) if ET system events are divided into groups, or group = 1 if not.
        Parameters:
        group - group the event belongs to

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Priority pri)
        Sets the event's priority, either high Priority.HIGH or low Priority.LOW. Low priority is normal while high priority events get placed at the front of stations' input and output event lists.
        Specified by:
        setPriority in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        pri - event priority

      • setOwner

        public void setOwner(int owner)
        Sets the owner of the event (attachment using event or system).
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of event (attachment using event or system)

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int len)
               throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the event's data length in bytes.
        Specified by:
        setLength in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        len - data length
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if length is less than zero

      • setLengthFromServer

        public void setLengthFromServer(int len)
                         throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the length of valid data from server where sizeLimit may be 0.
        Parameters:
        len - length of valid data
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if len is negative

      • setMemSize

        public void setMemSize(int memSize)
        Sets the size of the data buffer in bytes.
        Parameters:
        memSize - size of the data buffer in bytes

      • setDataStatus

        public void setDataStatus(org.jlab.coda.et.enums.DataStatus status)
        Sets the event's data status. It can be ok DataStatus.OK which is the default, corrupted DataStatus.CORRUPT which is never used actually, or possibly corrupted DataStatus.POSSIBLYCORRUPT which occurs when a process holding the event crashes and the system recovers it.
        Parameters:
        status - data status

      • setModify

        public void setModify(org.jlab.coda.et.enums.Modify modify)
        Sets whether the user wants to read the event only, will modify only the event header (everything except the data), or will modify the data and/or header. Modifying the data and/or header is Modify.ANYTHING, modifying only the header is Modify.HEADER, else the default assumed, Modify.NOTHING, is that nothing is modified resulting in this event being put back into the ET system (by remote server) immediately upon being copied and that copy sent to the user.
        Parameters:
        modify - is Modify.ANYTHING, Modify.HEADER, or Modify.NOTHING.

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(int endian)
                  throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the event data's byte order by using values consistent with C-based ET systems, EtConstants.endianBig, EtConstants.endianLittle, EtConstants.endianLocal, EtConstants.endianNotLocal, or EtConstants.endianSwitch.
        Specified by:
        setByteOrder in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        endian - endian value
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if argument is a bad value

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Set the event data's byte order.
        Specified by:
        setByteOrder in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        order - data's byte order

      • setRawByteOrder

        public void setRawByteOrder(int byteOrder)
                     throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the event data's byte order as big with 0x04030201 or as little with 0x01020304. This is how byte order is stored internally in this object and how it is stored in the C code.
        Specified by:
        setRawByteOrder in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        byteOrder - data's byte order as big with 0x04030201 or as little with 0x01020304.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if argument is a bad value

      • setControl

        public void setControl(int[] con)
                throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the event's control array by copying it into the event.
        Specified by:
        setControl in interface EtEvent
        Parameters:
        con - control array
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if control array has the wrong number of elements

      • setData

        public void setData(byte[] data)
        Sets the event's data without copying. The length and memSize members of the event are automatically set to the data array's length. Used only by local Java ET system in newEvents to increase data array size.
        Parameters:
        data - data array

      • setDataBuffer

        public void setDataBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer dataBuffer)
        Sets the event's data buffer (must be backed by data array). This is used when reading data from shared memory and also if remote user gets new events with the no-buffer arg true. In the latter case, the user must set the data buffer explicitly or an exception will result when trying to put the event back. In any case, using this method should only be done by the expert user.
        Parameters:
        dataBuffer - event's data buffer (must be backed by data array)

      • needToSwap

        public boolean needToSwap()
        Tells caller if the event data needs to be swapped in order to be the same byte order as the local JVM. This method is not needed when accessing data through the ByteBuffer object and endianness is handled behind the scenes.
        Specified by:
        needToSwap in interface EtEvent
        Returns:
        true if swapping is needed, otherwise false
